ch.bfh.btx8081.w2015.red.Schlurp.persistenceLayer

Class MedicineManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.bfh.btx8081.w2015.red.Schlurp.persistenceLayer.MedicineManager

  • public class MedicineManager
extends java.lang.Object
    The Medicine Manager is used to call certain Methods from the class MedicamentList. The Methods of the MedicineManager itself are called by the UserManager witch is used to link the Application Logic with the Data provided by the text Files and the Data entered by the User.
    Author:
    Rea, Mauro

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void createMediListObject(java.lang.String user)
      reads the Informations form the appropriate text file and generates a new ArrayList of Medicaments for the MediListView
      static MedicineManager getInstance()
      Instances mc of type MedicineManager if mc is null.
      java.util.ArrayList<Medicament> getMediList() 
      void removeMedicament(java.lang.String mediName, java.lang.String user)
      Removes first the Medicament with mediName from the MedicamentList and writes then the new List to the File
      void saveMedicament(java.lang.String user, Medicament medi)
      the medicament to be saved gets first "overwritten" (if it already existed) then the old text file with the old medicamentlist gets overwritten with the new one

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static MedicineManager getInstance()
        Instances mc of type MedicineManager if mc is null. This method is necessary, to be sure it exists only one instance of the class MedicineManager
        Returns:
        - a MedicineManager Object

      • removeMedicament

        public void removeMedicament(java.lang.String mediName,
                             java.lang.String user)
        Removes first the Medicament with mediName from the MedicamentList and writes then the new List to the File
        Parameters:
        mediName - - the Name of the Medicament
        user - - the name of the current user

      • getMediList

        public java.util.ArrayList<Medicament> getMediList()

      • setMediList

        public void setMediList(java.util.ArrayList<Medicament> mediList)

      • saveMedicament

        public void saveMedicament(java.lang.String user,
                           Medicament medi)
        the medicament to be saved gets first "overwritten" (if it already existed) then the old text file with the old medicamentlist gets overwritten with the new one
        Parameters:
        user - - the name of the current user
        medi - - the medicament object to be saved

      • createMediListObject

        public void createMediListObject(java.lang.String user)
        reads the Informations form the appropriate text file and generates a new ArrayList of Medicaments for the MediListView
        Parameters:
        user - - the name of the current user
